meanings.definition: A person who signs a negotiable instrument, such as a check, to transfer ownership to another party.
meanings.sent1: The indorser of the check was happy to help his friend.
meanings.sent2: The bank required the indorser to provide identification.
meanings.sent3: The indorser accidentally signed the check upside down, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: She was the indorser of good luck, always bringing fortune to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The indorser's signature was so unique that it stood out on every document.

meanings.definition: To sign one's name on the back of a negotiable instrument to transfer ownership.
meanings.sent1: He indorsed the check quickly before handing it over.
meanings.sent2: Remember to indorse the document before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: She indorsed the contract with a flourish, feeling important.
meanings.sent4: The artist indorsed his paintings with a small symbol in the corner.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reminded the student to indorse the assignment to complete the process.
